18630.description: eMemo memory matching games are fascinating and educational memory-challenging games that explore the world. eMemo games stimulate and enhance the memory while teaching about Geography, Architecture, Design and History. The theme of all eMemo games is that they play similarly to a traditional memory game, except that instead of matching two identical images, eMemo requires players to match a photo with a zoomed-in section of that same photo.

18633.name: A Little Golden Book I SEE YOU! Game
18633.description:
From the publisher:

Shy Little Kitten and friends want to play "Peek-a-boo, I See You!", with your child. Place a character card in a sleeve and insert screens that progressively reveal more of the picture. Can you guess who's there?

18634.description:
From the publisher:

Thomas, Percy, Mavis and James are racing to see who can make three in a row! Rules for different skill-levels of play.

Contents: Game board, 20 engine tiles, instruction sheet for different skill-levels of play
18634.name: Thomas Tic Tac Toe Game

18635.name: Monopoly: Japan
18635.description: The colour sets to collect are major cities around Japan. Instead of railway stations, there are complete railways. This seems to be a fairly straight translation of the more well-known game.

18636.name: Monopoly: Roppongi Hills
18636.description:
Roppongi Hills is a huge residential/business area in Tokyo that was opened in 2003. It includes a television station, galleries and museums, and very tall office towers. Instead of houses there are kiosks, and hotels are bigger retail shops ... and if you build enough shops, you get to build a Mori Tower.

(Mori was the businessman who spent billions buying up the land over a couple of decades - including the Australian Embassy, which was in a historic building which had an even more historic and beautiful garden.)

18637.name: Monopoly: Ultraman
18637.description:
Ultraman is a creation of the 1960s and a huge part of popular Japanese culture. Various incarnations of Ultraman battle an assortment of weird monsters.
The Ultraman Monopoly edition has Ultrapods instead of houses and Ultratowers instead of hotels.

18638.description:
The game consists of a battle between French and English troops. The army consists of artillery, cavalry and infantry who are used on a tiled board. Artillery is slow but powerful, cavalry is fast but weak and infantry are in between. Take care of the artillery because unguarded cannons can be taken over by the enemy!

By moving and advancing the troops one can attack the other (with dice).
18638.name: Kriegspiel

18639.name: StapleWars
18639.description:
From the designer:

"The StapleWars board game is a game which combines action games, which involve moving parts (along the lines of Mousetrap or Weapons of War) and strategy games, which involve building and conquering, (like Risk or Axis and Allies) in one. All units and structures are made out of HEAVY DUTY staples, which can be found at any hardware store. Staplewars plays like a strategy game... until it is time to attack. Ammunition staples are flicked at units and structures, and if the units or structures are knocked down, they are destroyed! The purpose of this page is to encourage people to play this exciting game, to give people instructions for their own StapleWars arenas and sets, and to clarify information about this exciting new game. Give it a try, it is a lot of fun!"

18640.name: The Great Muppet Caper Game
18640.description:
From the rules:

Join KERMIT THE FROG, FOZZIE BEAR, MISS PIGGY and THE GREAT GONZO on a wild romp through the streets of London. Your favorite Muppet friends are in search of four very hard-to-capture thieves who are trying to steal a legendary jewel called the "Baseball Diamond". Join the Muppets on their adventure. If you're the first player to catch the four thieves and save the "Baseball Diamond", you'll wind the game.

Here's some of the fun you'll have...take a cab and a bus, both of which are controlled by hidden wheels underneath the gameboard...be careful, though...if you spin the wheel too much or too little, you'll miss your bus or fail to hail a cab! Visit the Dubonnet Club with its mysterious spinning room and the Mallory Gallery where the "Baseball Diamond" is hidden. To enter the Gallery, you must make a precarious climb up the side of the Gallery Building. Then before you can save the jewel, you must be sure you own four different Thief cards. If you own the four cards, turn the hidden dial in the Gallery hoping that the jewel will be set free and come rolling out the front door of the Gallery (the jewel will be dislodged only when this hidden dial is spun a certain number of times). The player who frees the jewel from its hiding place wins the game. Have fun!

18641.description:
Collectible card game designed by Alexander Duncan, with roleplaying elements sold in starters and boosters. Artwork by Jamie Grant.

In 'Banemaster one of the players draws from the green deck and plays the evil Banemaster, the other players draw from the red deck and are sworn to fight the evil in the Banemaster's Castle.

During play, each player draws 8 cards from their respective decks: The Banemaster sets the location for his round and describes the setting. The other players go questing to defeat the Banemaster and his horde of monsters, while also trying to evade traps, collect treasure and score points. At the end of the round the Banemaster role rotates to the next player, and the game continues.
18641.name: Banemaster

18642.name: Commuter
18642.description:
COMMUTER is a simple roll and move boardgame about travel and (UK) road signs, for 2-5 players.

Players start at home and have to make five circuits of the board, representing journeys to work on Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday and Friday.

Players take it in turns to move their (car) markers the number of space determined by the roll of dice. The space that is landed on, many of which are marked with appropriate road signs, may affect the playing piece either in that round (go back to...) or in the next (throw 7 or more to proceed..).

Certain squares require a question on road safety or the rules of the road to answered. These are graded into three levels to allow people of mixed ages to play.

Each circuit of the board earns a player a counter in his or her color. The first player to receive five counters by completing his final journey with an exact roll of the dice is the winner.

18643.name: Motala Strom
18643.description:
Motala Strom is a unique 1-dimensional abstract strategy game where one tries to capture all of the opposing pieces, or having your very last piece standing in your home base. The board consists simply of 9 spaces. The game is named after a river in Sweden.

Online Play


Super Duper Games

18645.name: Coronation Street
18645.description:
A trivia board game based on the popular UK ITV Soap "Coronation Street."

Features a board that looks like the famous street and includes a "who's who" booklet.

18646.description:
A children's game which is effectively a promotional item for Land Rover cars. The game is a simple roll and move game similar to Snakes and Ladders. It comes with a laminated board, a set of rules, and a cut-out spinner and pieces.

The winner is the first player to reach the finish on an off road track, but you have to beware of hazards along the way, such as broken fan belts, mud, etc.
18646.name: Land Rover

18647.name: Colpevole!
18647.description:
A Clue-style game.

One of the players plays the guilty party ("Colpevole") and knows the story (there are 40 different scenarios). All the other players have to find out the motives and dynamics of the murder.

18648.description:
Kidnapped from your home world by decadent aliens, you have been transformed into a deadly cyborg warrior battling in star-crossed arenas for survival, glory, and, just perhaps, your freedom. You are one of the CyborGladiators!

This fast, fun, and furious tabletop fighting game includes rules for creating your own cyborgs with more than 30 unique cybernetic implants, earning glory in careers mode, and building an endless variety of arenas filled with dangers such as flamethrowers and pools of boiling acid for exceptional replay value. Featuring a cover by Bart Willard and interior art by Bart Willard and Richard Cox, the game includes a cardstock sheet of foldable color cyborg figures or you can play using your own action figures or miniatures. Ages 13 and up, no game master required

Expanded by:

Invincible
18648.name: CyborGladiators

18649.name: Home Run Baseball Challenge
18649.description: Home Run Baseball Challenge is a two player baseball game where pitches, hits and fielding are determined by the rolls of custom dice and plays are planned using field action strategy cards.

18651.description:
The story is short: You move one of five well known characters from Springfield (Homer, Bart, Lisa, Flanders or Krusty) through the Springfield cemetery. The player who first finds three treasures is the winner.

It's possible to transform into a zombie or to steal treasures from your opponent.

Every character has two different attributes (normal and zombie). For example: Homer can move walls as a zombie and walk through walls when he is "normal."
18651.name: The Simpsons Horror Show

18652.description:
Subtitled "War of 1812 Land and Naval Battles."

From the publisher:

England is at war with Napoleon in Europe. American honor is being tarnished as the British Navy seizes American shipping and impresses her sailors in sight of her shores. America launches a war to regain her honor and perhaps capture Canada from England, thus securing her northern border. The war will see the burning of the White House by the British and a great battle won by America after the war is officially over. The American Navy will distinguish itself against the greatest naval power in the world. You are in command at New Orleans, Chippewa, Lundy's Lane, and many other land battles. On the water in command of the Constitution and other ships, can you bring the British Navy to her knees? It's up to you, For Honor and Glory!

Game includes land map, naval map, terrain tiles, hardwood wooden counters, labels, miniature ships, dice, rules and scenario booklets.


Land Scenarios

Queenston Heights, October 13, 1812
Cranery Island, June 22, 1813
Battle of the Thames, October 5, 1813
Crysler's Farm, November 11, 1813
Chippawa, July 5, 1814
Lundy's Lane, July 25, 1814
Bladensburg, August 24, 1814
North Point, September 12, 1814
Jackson's Night Attack, December 23-24, 1814
New Orleans, January 8, 1815


Naval Scenarios

Battle of Lake Erie, September 10, 1813
Battle of Lake Champlain, September 11, 1814
USS Constitution vs. HMS Guerriere, August 19, 1812
USS Wasp vs. HMS Frolic, October 18, 1812
USS United States vs. HMS Macedonian, October 25, 1812
USS Constitution vs. HMS Java, December 29, 1812
USS Chesapeake vs. HMS Shannon, June 1, 1813
USS Argus vs. HMS Pelican, August 14, 1813
USS Essex vs. HMS Phoebe and HMS Cherub, March 28, 1814
Capture of the USS President, January 15, 1815
USS Constitution vs. HMS Cyane and HMS Levant, February 20, 1815
18652.name: For Honor and Glory: War of 1812 Land and Naval Battles

18653.description: A memory variant with pictures of Thomas the Tank Engine and friends. Three different games are included: Station Stop Matching Game, Thomas & Friends Memory Game and Sir Topham Hatt's What's Missing? Memory Game.
18653.name: Thomas' Station Stop Matching Game

18654.name: Serata in Giallo: Il Mistero del Nuraghe
18654.description:
Serata in Giallo (Evening of Mystery) is the premier collection of murder mystery games to appear in Italy. The players are invited to an Evening of Mystery, during the course of which each player enacts the role of one of the protagonists of the event. The games unfold in “acts” with a theatrical flavor, and the game may or may not include an "investigation team."

Il Mistero del Nuraghe (The Mystery of the Nuraghe)

The “nuraghe,” as they are known, are mysterious ancient stone buildings that are found only in Sardinia…
Andrea Centofanti had been fine-tuning his personal theory that held that the nuraghe were none other than the “birthplace of fire." In order to verify his theory, he had decided to go to Sardinia to live for a few weeks inside a nuraghe.
Four other people went with him, with the idea of spending a vacation that was a bit outside of the ordinary—without some of the comforts of home and without electric power.
They thought they had prepared for everything, but none of them had counted on the tragedy that soon befalls them. Angelo Corsini, one of the members of the expedition, dies in the blaze that he himself mysteriously creates in the nuraghe where he sleeps!

Place—Sardinia (Italy)

Time—1985

Characters—Five (3 men and 2 women):

Donatella Carta: 30-year-old professional assistant to a Milanese fashion designer. Girlfriend of Andrea Centofanti.

Andrea Centofanti: 35-year-old archaeologist. He is the boyfriend of Donatella Carta.

Fanny Corsini: 22-year-old aspiring actress. She is the girlfriend of Giovanni Lo Presti.

Giovanni Lo Presti: 25-year-old medical student. Fanny’s boyfriend.

Marisa Piccoli: 38-year-old athlete and actress. Married to a rich building contractor from Milan.

18655.name: Serata in Giallo: Luna di Miele sul Nilo
18655.description:
Serata in Giallo (Evening of Mystery) is the premier collection of murder mystery games to appear in Italy. The players are invited to an Evening of Mystery, during the course of which each player enacts the role of one of the protagonists of the event. The games unfold in “acts” with a theatrical flavor, and the game may or may not include an "investigation team."

Luna di Miele sul Nilo (Honeymoon on the Nile)

The Excelsa, a luxury boat carrying a couple on their wedding cruise, floats slowly down the Nile in the direction of Cairo. On board is the famous “Dogon Wizard,” an illusionist who has the assignment of entertaining the passengers. But just when the show is nearing the apex of tension, something terrible happens.
The investigators must now perceive this situation as a typical "case" in the tradition of the "locked room": André Tavernier and his girlfriend come to their deaths in their suite which is dead-bolted from the inside. Who killed them, and above, all how? This is a homicide that only two persons can apparently have committed: the Dogon Wizard with his extraordinary paranormal powers, or the devil in person!

Place
Egypt

Time
June 1990

Characters
Seven—4 men and 3 women

Jean Giannetti (Dogon Wizard): 37 years old. A fascinating man who is always surrounded by beautiful women.

Nando Restuccia: 30 years old. An extroverted and talkative gymnastics teacher.

Pauline Tavernier Restuccia: 24 years old. Most passionate about astrology and African history.

Marc Grun: 30-year-old journalist. Specializes in winter sports.

Isabel Grun: 22 years old. Completed her studies in America where she specialized in the History of Ancient Civilizations.

Mohammed: The Arabic guide. A beautiful tawny boy of 26 years of age. He always has a smile.

Patricia Breton: Science teacher from Marseilles. She is 33 years old. She is a woman with a lot of personality—level-headed and without delusions.

18656.description:
A CCG based on racing and fighting dragons.

From the website:

Dragon City is a place where the different colors of dragon are bred for sport, profit and industrial use. Different colors of draconium are purified and machined into various forms of gear and accessories designed to enhance dragon power. Dragon City is the place where the power struggles of the planet are played out on the vast Elite Class racing tracks. Here, mighty racers like modern day gladiators battle in 200 mile-per-hour competitions using glowing draconium gear and dragon energy in fierce hand to hand and dragon versus dragon struggles. In the deeper parts of the city, teens race and battle on the All City Racing Circuit hoping for a shot at the big time. Below in the depths, in a place called Squire’s End, dangerous Down City Crews wait, like street gangs, trying to fight their way up, not realizing that they are the remnants of the original empires that caused the first dragon-human war.
18656.name: Dragon Booster Trading Card Game

18657.name: Test Match
18657.description: This is not so much of a game as a device for simulating a test match. The board holds a score board and two rotating randomizers. The bowler rotates his handle to first ball of the over and back to the start, revealing a type of ball (leg break, bouncer, etc). The batsman rotates his handle to the type of ball bowled, and back again, revealing a batsman scoring runs or being dismissed. If you know the rules of cricket, it's obvious how to simulate a test match given these rules.

18658.name: Malhação
18658.description: In Malhação, players try to discover each other preferences. Each one writes down their favorite song, movie, travel spot, etc. Then players arrange meetings on the board and exchange confidences. Some places have special powers, and each player can lie three times during the game, so knowing whether to trust or not an information is very important.

18659.name: Twin Treasures
18659.description:
From the back of the box:

There's a bounty of learning contained in this high seas memory game where children match objects hidden in an adventurous tropical environment.

18660.description:
From the box:

A domino game. In this simple game of observation, children lay brightly colored picture cards of cars, boats, trains, fire engines and helicopters on the table, next to other cards that show the same picture. The first player to get rid of all his or her cards is the winner.

Ages 3 - 6
18660.name: Cars, Boats & Trains

18661.description:
Alapo is a strategy game. Each player owns twelve abstract pieces, two each of six different kinds. Round pieces move in any of the eight directions on the 6 by 6 board; square pieces move only orthogonally and triangular pieces only diagonally. Large pieces move any distance, small pieces only one field per turn.
Opponent pieces can be eliminated by moving onto their position. The goal is to reach the opponent's base line with one of your pieces without the opponent being able to eliminate your piece in his/her next move.
18661.name: Alapo

18662.name: Colossus
18662.description:
Bonus game included in Dragon Magazine #271.

Through Research, Development, and Fighting, you must improve your creature until he has a 6 or more in each of his body areas - 2 arms, 2 legs, heart and head.

Equipment: Pencil and Paper, six 6-sided dice, at least five 8-sided dice.

From the intro paragraph:

In Colossus, each player is a mad scientist building some sort of creature. Perhaps it's a stone golem, perhaps it's a wicker man, perhaps it's a plain old laser-shootin' butt-kickin' giant robot. Whatever the details, you're building them, and you like to make them fight.

18663.description:
Bonus game from Dragon Magazine #273.

Cards can be discarded or used in a battle. When the draw deck is empty, the ship sinks, and there is a showdown to see who ends up in which lifeboat. Points are totaled for the hand, and multiple hands add up to a game target of 200.

A variation for 6-8 players and two decks is included.

Components are the rules and a "battle mat" depicting the pirate ship and lifeboats. Illustrations by John Kovalic.

From the intro paragraph:

The rats are long gone, but you're still here. You and your greedy pirate pals are hustling around the deck of a sinking pirate ship, trying to scoop up as much treasure as you can hold. You've got to have a little treasure to buy your way into a lifeboat, and the best lifeboats are the ones with the most treasure in them. It's kind of complicated. Then again, maybe you're just not very smart.
18663.name: Abandon Ship!

18664.description:
The "Elite" blocksets for Victory: The Blocks of War add additional unit types, and are available in the same player colors as the base game and expansions. Red and blue are the original colors, but green, orange, gray, and black are also available. Note that each color of elite blockset is sold separately, so you'll need at least two elite sets (presumably a red elite, and a blue elite set each to start with) in order to allow play with elite units.

Like the original game's 50 units per side, each Elite blockset has 50 block units, but in 12 new unit types: elite fighters, torpedo bombers, medium bombers, destroyers, cruisers, elite armor, artillery, mechanized, mountain, engineers, marines, supply and resource units.

Expands:

Victory: The Blocks of War
18664.name: Victory: The Blocks of War – Elite Blocksets

18665.description:
Without expansion, Victory is a two-player game. The regular expansion blocksets for Victory each contain 50 wooden block units in any of 6 available colors: the red and blue of the base game, or orange, green, gray or black. Expansion blocksets come with a few simple additional rules for multi-player games.

Expands:

Victory: The Blocks of War
18665.name: Victory: The Blocks of War – Additional Blocksets

18666.description:
The Logistics set adds factories and other logistical issues to Victory.

Land, sea and air units each have their own factories, replacing the generic city production points of the standard game. Airfields can now be built, allowing air units to land even without a city or town. Mulberries are temporary ports that can be built by Marines. A storm affects a cluster of seven hexes and moves randomly each turn, preventing unit movement. All the logistics installations can be attacked and damaged or even destroyed, as can now bridges and canals, and appropriate markers are provided.

Expands:

Victory: The Blocks of War
18666.name: Victory: The Blocks of War – Logistics Set

18668.name: Grafolampo
18668.description:
From the rules:

Grafolampo is a new, enthralling and instructive amusement, which has been invented for intelligent boys and for adults who are keen on puzzles.

Grafolampo is a competing cross-word, which leaves no ground to fortune but assigns victory to the promptest and shrewdest player.

The box includes:
4 game boards
300 letter cards
1 card distributor

18669.name: Port-Os
18669.description:
In this game you are a pirate and with your ship you have to explore the archipelago, find the lost treasures and return to the bank on the main island.

Beware the other pirates who try to rob you, and also the many monsters you encounter on your way.

The first to collect 30 treasure points is the winner.

18670.description:
From the publisher:

"Tacos, spaghetti, and steak with ice cream. Lay down cards that match either the tasty foods or cool colors. No matching card? Play a wild crazy #8 and name a new color! With a bit of strategy and a pinch of luck, the first player to get rid of their cards wins!"

A SimplyFun version of the card game "Crazy Eights," using "oversized cards with engaging artwork" depicting various foods (instead of standard card suits). "Ideal for play dates and parties."
18670.name: Crazy Ates

18671.name: Chums
18671.description:
"Fish love to be with their friends! Can you bring all the Chums back together? Ask others for cards by number or go fishing to try and catch a pair of matching Chums. The player with the most pairs at the end of the game wins."

A SimplyFun version of the card game "Go Fish". Cards depict colorful fish.

18672.name: Asalto al Poder
18672.description: Asalto al Poder is a tactical game for two players or teams who fight for the control of the capital city in a hypothetical state during a "Coup d'Etat". One of them controls the loyalist, the other the revolutionary forces. Combat is the last opcion, players try to atract the other's player counters to its side and win strategic locations.

18673.name: Texas Politicos
18673.description:
"A game of MONEY, POWER, and FUN For the OFFICALs and UNOFFICALS in and out fo the great state off TEXAS!

Dedicated to the FIGHTIN' and FUN LOVIN' members fo the TEXAS LEGISLATURE" (direct quote from box cover)

A satirical game about collecting enough votes and cash to achieve office in Texas. The bank in Sharpstown plays banker "under the table and from a brown bag," while another player (the election judge from Duvall County) tracks the winning conditions. The rule sheet is half a page long, and does not include any instructions other than setting up and winning the game. However, it appears to be a simple "roll the dice, react to square landed on" game while the players tour a linear board (the only path is to follow the outline of the state) until they can get enough votes and cash to reach the middle.

18674.name: Kubla's Gambol
18674.description:
Components:

7 KublaCoins with values 1-7
Two sets of 10 KublaCards with values 1-10

Game Idea:

"Both players start with one set of KublaCards and play them alternately next to one of the KublaCoins. When all cards have been played, the player with the higher total power next to it, controls the coin. The player with the higher total value of controlled coins wins the game."

This was given to attendees of KublaCon 2005.

18675.name: Off to See the Wizard
18675.description:
Off to See the Wizard Game - based on the animated TV series.

Players assume the roles of Dorothy and her friends, competing with each other, trying to capture the Witch and bring her to the Wizard.

The Game is played in two parts. The first part consists of chasing and capturing the Witch.

Player pieces travel on red circles and the Witch disc travels on yellow triangles. If a player piece and the Witch disc coincide on a black square the player captures the Witch.

The second part is getting the Witch to the Wizard.

The player with the Witch disc tries to get it to the Wizard while chased by the other players.

The Witch may exchange hands several times before one player succeeds in getting her to the Wizard to win the game.

Components:

- 5 die-cut markers with stands representing Dorothy, Toto, the Lion, the Tin Woodsman and the Scarecrow.

- 2 six-sided dice (1 red & 1 white).

- 1 Witch disc.

- Playing board.

- Two-part box.

18676.name: Frozen Pond Hockey
18676.description:
This is a stats-based hockey simulation game that features many minor league and historical seasons.

Players are rated for ability to score, pass, and play defense.

18677.name: Mirror Mania
18677.description:
Which Reflection Goes Which Direction? You Make the Connection!

At the start of the game, a random maze of Mirror Blocks is set up on the board. Players use their spatial relations skills to try to predict various paths through the maze in an attempt to find the highest-scoring path.

In the simplest version of the game, the player is allowed to see the arrows on top of the Mirror Blocks to find scoring paths that lead to Target Pegs. The instructions also include optional rules to increase the difficulty of game-play for more expert players. Players can move or rotate a Mirror Block to increase their score or to try to block their opponent.

The player places the View Cube at the beginning of a selected path. They then place their finger on the Target Peg that they think is at the end of the path. The player looks down into the View Cube. If the predicted Peg is seen, the player scores by adding the values of the Mirror Blocks and the Target Peg to their existing score. If the selected Target Peg is not correct, the player scores nothing…

Mirror Mania is a fun and relatively quick-playing game, and the Day-Glo® hot pink, electric yellow, and fire orange Mirror Cubes are a retro blast!

18678.name: Mirror Mania
18678.description:
Take the driver's seat in this sensational, brain-teasing game! Just follow the road from start to finish. Sounds simple…but can it be done using a reflected image? Whether alone, with friends, or at a party, Mirror Mania is sure to bring hours of fun, laughter and excitement.

Contents: Easy-to-Assemble Game Tray, Play sheets, 2 Felt Tip Pens, Instruction Sheet.

Follow the simple instructions for the easy-to-assemble game tray. Choose a play sheet and pen. Now you're ready to get behind the wheel! Observe the reflected image through the eye holes on the viewer panel. Place a pen at Start and go…Oops! Stay on the road! Fun to do, hilarious to watch. The eyes see an image the hand won't follow. Your mind says go, but your hand says no!

18679.name: Morgan's Revenge
18679.description:
From the Web Site: "MORGAN'S REVENGE comes complete with authentic replicas of gold doubloons and silver Pieces of Eight with a 16 page handbook of Pirate Lore, and rules to this brass top game of chance. All the game pieces fit in a neat little printed bag. "

From the "Handbook Of Pirate Lore":
The Rules - The top has six sides. The marks generally mean:
T1 - The spinner, or pirate in this case, takes one (1) Ante from the pot.
T2 - The spinner takes two (2) Antes from the pot.
P1 - The spinner Re-Antes one (1) into the pot
P2 - The spinner Re-Antes two (2) into the pot
AP - The spinner and "All Players" Re-Ante one (1) into the pot
TA - The spinner "Takes All"

The spinner establishes the "Ante" amount to start a round. There can be any number of rounds to a game. The "Ante" can be anything from a set amount of money, to goats. That's why soldiers and pirates loved this game! Any spinner can start a round of play. The top can be passed in any direction as long as it maintains that same direction the entire round.

This game is a simple repackaging of traditional Teetotum or the later 60's version Put & Take Game

18680.name: Football Dice
18680.description:
NFL Football simulation. Three colored dice for offense. Two more colored dice for special actions.

Roll the dice and see if you scored a touchdown or not.

18682.description: The aim of the game is to invite nice relatives to your family feast, but watch out for the nasty ones (such as your mother in law)!
18682.name: Schreck lass nach!

18683.name: Salta
18683.description:
Two players sit opposite a 10×10 checkered board with a light square in the lower right. Each player has 15 unique pieces in his own color, arranged on the dark squares of the nearest three ranks. From left to right, the pieces are one through five stars (first rank), moons (second rank) and suns (third rank).

The pieces move one square diagonally in any direction to a vacant square, or must leap over one opposing piece (only opposing pieces, but without capture - there are no captures in Salta) if the square immediately beyond is vacant. Only one jump is made (no chain jumping), and missed opportunities to jump may be forced by the opponent, although a player is free to choose among several available jumps. Blockading all of the opposing pieces is not allowed, although some may be temporarily blocked as long as the opponent still has a legal move.

The goal is to be the first player to move all of his pieces as into the starting places of the corresponding opposing piece. That is, reading from right to left, the goal position is one through five stars (tenth rank), one through five moons (ninth rank) and one through five suns (eighth rank). The player first achieving this position wins by as many points as the number of moves opponent would need to achieve his goal position.

If neither player reaches the goal position by the time 120 moves have been made by each player, the score is calculated as the difference between the number of moves each player would need to reach the goal position, as if the board were clear of opposing pieces.

Online Play


http://www.iggamecenter.com/ - igGameCenter (real-time)

18685.name: The Comical Game of Who?
boardgameversion: Retro Range Toys and Games edition
18685.description:
This game includes 60 cards; each with an answer on the top, number in the middle and a question on the bottom.

The cards bearing uneven numbers are divided among the men or boys. The even numbers are divided among the ladies or girls.

The player holding Number One card begins the game by reading the question on that card.

The player holding the Number Two card reads reads the answer at the top, getting up and making a courtesy as she does so. She then reads her question at the foot of the card, and Number Three reads his answer, standing up and bowing as he does so.

Proceed thus until all the cards are read. The answer to the question on card Number Sixty being read by Number One.

Per the rules: "The fun caused by the ridiculous questions and answers can be imagined when the game is played by a lively company."

18686.name: Gazdálkodj Okosan!
18686.description:
The workmanship of this game of the communist period (1946-1989) is obviously very poor. The big game board is made of heavy cardboard and is in a large envelope. The equipment is in a smaller but solid blue box. The rules say the game is for 2 to 7 players, but apparently the banker is one of them, because there are but 6 tokens.

Aim of the game is to save that much that a house can be bought and subsequently furnished with goods like a vacuum cleaner, living room furnishing, kitchen furnishing, radio, washing machine and a sewing machine. The first player to furnish the house and additionally has saved at least 2,000 Ft in saving bonds is the winner.
To that end each player get a house-plan in which he has to fill up 6 parts. The house can only be bought at O.T.P. (19), where as the furniture can be bought at space (11). At space (33) one can buy all domestic appliances at Keravill's.
Very striking of this "party game" is clearly pedagogic second objective. That does appear from the pedantic phrases of some Chance cards like:

Go to the cinema! The movies are instructive and entertaining. Advance to space (17) and pay 10 Ft.
Exercise is healthy and entertaining. You should exercise as well. Advance to space (7).
Read! Reading is pleasant, useful and cheap entertainment.
You have dirtied the street! Pay 10 Ft.


The scene is laid in Budapest and vicinity appearing from the fact that a stroll can be taken over the Margit isle (26), go to the Fishermen's Bastion (29), make a trip over the Donau to Visegrád (38) and one may/have to stay 2 turns at Lake Balaton.
A few other fields are: a shoe-shop (14), a cinema (17), a tobacco-shop (20), a confectioner's shop (24), a stores (28) and a theater (36).
There are 41 spaces in total, of which 6x Szerencsekerék (Wheel of Fortune). There are 46 Wheel of Fortune cards (60x90 mm) but these cards have no illustration. There are 60 savings bonds (58x88 mm) of 1000 Ft and 30 savings bonds of 5,000 Ft. The money consists of 6 neutral banknotes printed in color on white paper: 10 - 20 - 50 - 100 - 200 and 1000 Ft. Each player receives 4,000 Ft at the start of the game. On/over Start you receive 4,000.-/2,000 Ft as wages.

The price of this set amounted to 52.40 Ft at the time of issue.

The title translates as "Budget smartly!"

18687.description:
This game covers one of the battles of the Reconquista, Las Navas de Tolosa, 1212. It uses a refinement of the "Au fil de l'epee" system used in the games in issues 26 and 45.

This game originally appeared in Vae Victis issue 62. Like all Vae Victis games, the counters need to be mounted and cut out before play. This issue also includes errata counters for the previous issue's game (Ebre).
18687.name: Las Navas de Tolosa, 1212

18689.name: Donald Duck Flips His Lid
18689.description: Using two Donald Ducks, you flip cone shaped pieces to score on a numbered board... Think Tiddly Winks meets Disney marketing.

18690.description:
From the Urban Mammoth web site:

Urban War is a bi-monthly, sci-fi skirmish game set in the Void 1.1 Universe. Players build small teams of soldiers to fight in the war torn city-planet of Iskandria. Every issue introduces new troops for each of the factions: Viridians, Junkers, VASA, and Syntha as the war on Iskandria unfolds. The individual model and experienced based system allows you to develop your teams to suit your strategies and tactics. We've marked this issue "ZERO" because this is the basic game system, further issues will develop the game and the world. The next issues will be more magazine-like in their content. They will of course have new rules and bring in new troop types but they will focus heavily on the support side of the game with scenarios, painting and modeling guides and a lot more fiction.
18690.name: Urban War

18693.name: Bible Eights
18693.description: Bible Eights is a Crazy Eights variant which uses Bible characters.

18694.name: Bacchanales
18694.description:
Bacchanales provides the step-by-step process, elements, and references required to accurately observe, smell, and taste a wine in order to determine the varietal, the vintage year, and even the appellation of a wine without having seen its label. Detect the greatest number of clues and win the game.

Contents:
· 40 aroma reference vials
· 4 flavor reference vials
· 100 fill-in wine-tasting forms
· 2 wine-tasting guides
· 1 measuring spoon
· 1 glass Testaroma

Method:
The game unfolds in two phases: 1) Training players to recognize the aromas found in wine; 2) Observation and tasting of the wine itself.

1st Phase: Acquainting players with the aromas. This phase may constitute a full-fledged game in itself (see Variant below). It is then a challenge of trying to guess the scent in each aroma vial (the answer is on the bottom).

These aromas are divided into 4 groups:
· 21 primary reference aromas (varietal aromas), ex: leather, licorice, apricot, etc....
· 7 secondary aromas (wine-making aromas), ex: cinnamon, lemon, etc....
· 7 tertiary aromas (aromas of aging), ex: prune, mushroom, etc....
· 5 odors indicating the principal defects found in wine, ex: detergent, cork, etc....

2nd Phase: The game itself. Each players has been asked to bring a bottle of wine. All players have taken care to conceal the label from the other players. The person whose wine is being tasted will temporarily be the game moderator while all others will try to answer the questions regarding the wine’s origin, vintage, grape varietal, defects, vinification process, aging potential, outcome, balance, etc. Sounds difficult or impossible? It’s not—and here’s why…

The accompanying wine-tasting guides provide all of the pertinent observations in wine-tasting. The players’ challenge is to accurately match the observations of the wine you are tasting with the ones listed in the guides. Alongside each observation you will find the interpretations or answers. For example, if you observe a red wine with a ruby shade and a brick reflection, the interpretation will be a “2- to 5-year old” wine. A Champagne or sparkling wine with small and fast bubbles is a “quality sparkling wine.”

Bacchanales was developed for wine-lovers of all levels, allowing participants to improve and perfect their knowledge in wine-tasting with each round. On average, 80 percent of all people who have no prior wine experience can answer 3 out of 5 questions accurately. In just one round, participants will become true connoisseurs, discovering the many secrets of wine-tasting.

Variant:
If your friends are Boardgame Geeks rather than wine-lovers, you can always forgo a regular game of Bacchanales to play a game of “Scent Identity.” This variant using olfactory memory is original and very instructive: Randomly select 10 or 12 of the aroma vials (a greater number makes the game a little long and difficult). On a sheet of paper, draw a corresponding number of circles. Label the circles with the names of the selected aromas. Mix the aroma vials. Set a time limit and have each player attempt to place the correct vial on the correct name!

boardgamehonor: 2005 Charles S. Roberts Best Modern Era Boardgame Nominee
18695.description:
From the Decision Games web site:

"This is the third game in the Lightning series. Fight the war on terror with America's cutting edge weapon systems! You have been charged with hunting down terrorists aiding regions around the world and toppling their corrupt governments. To accomplish this, you have been given command of the latest weapons and best personnel America has to offer. You get to command elements of the Air Force, Army, Navy, Marines, Special Forces and Propaganda Warfare. War on Terror is an ultra-low complexity card game for all ages. The focus is on fast card play, strategy, and fun interactive game play for 2-4 players. Includes 110 full color playing cards and one sheet of rules."

Lightning: War on Terror was a nominee in the Charles S. Roberts awards for Best Modern Era Boardgame (Charles S. Roberts Awards) for 2005.

Lightning Game Series
18695.name: Lightning: War on Terror

18696.name: Racer Knights of Falconus
18696.description:
From the publisher:

Speed and Valor Bring Victory

Enter the arena to race for glory! Choose your Racer Knight from the five species attending Falconus Academy—choose an elegant alfar, a mad gremlin, a brutish ogre, a human wizard, or a cunning serpid. Build your racer from a wide variety of engines, weapons, and more. Seize the win by completing the race first, or pummel your competitors so you’re the last Racer Knight on the track. And the crowd goes wild!

This is a "constructible strategy game" from Arthaus Publishing (an imprint of White Wolf).

18697.name: Think Twice
18697.description:
Originally published in GAMES Magazine in May 1986, Think Twice is a quick and light pencil and paper game for 2 players.

Sid Sackson invented this easy to learn game that involves shading spaces on two grids in an attempt to score the most points.

18698.name: Archimedes
18698.description:
Originally published in the July 1988 issue of GAMES Magazine, Archimedes is a nautical battle game for 2 players.

Archimedes can be played with a standard checkers set. The board is an 8×8 grid, and each player has 12 "ships" represented by checkers of one color. The object of the game is to capture opponent's ships in an attempt to land on the enemy's home port.

Online Play


Super Duper Games

18699.description:
EinStein würfelt nicht! is the official game accompanying an German exhibition about Einstein in the Einstein Year 2005. It's a fast paced game for 2 players.

The game board is 5×5 square fields large.

Each player controls 6 playing pieces i.e. stones with the numbers 1 to 6 marked on them.

The stones of player 1 are set up in the six fields of the upper left corner of the board and those of player 2 in the six fields of the lower right corner of the board so they face each other diagonally.

During his turn a player rolls a die, if he still has the stone with the number corresponding to the rolled value on the board he must move this stone. If the corresponding stone was already removed from play (see below) the player may choose to either move the stone with the next higher or the next lower number.

In his move player 1 may move the stone one field to the right, downward or diagonally to the lower right. Respectively player 2 may move the stone one field to the left, upward or diagonally to the upper left.

If a player ends his move on a field occupied by another stone, be it one of the opponent or one of his own stones, then this stone is removed from play.

To win the game a player must occupy the corner field of the opponent with a playing piece. A player loses if he has no more playing pieces left on the board.
boardgameversion: 3-Hirn-Verlag edition with orange and green glass stones
18699.name: EinStein würfelt nicht!

18701.description:
A small gladiatorial combat game with 5 pre-painted miniatures, an arena play sheet, and special dice. Players pit gladiators against each other in battle; each fighter comes with a number of special moves that can be selected at the start of the turn. Last man standing wins.

Integrates with:


Ludus Gladiatorius 2
18701.name: Ludus Gladiatorius

18702.name: Monopoly: Edição Sporting
18702.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

This is a Monopoly edition dedicated to one of the best Portuguese football (soccer) teams.

18703.description:
This German Trading Card Game is based on the weekly science fiction series Perry Rhodan. You you can play over the story from about the first 100 novellas issued. The game is broken up in different phases which you can play separately or one after another for a very long game. The phases with different backsides are:

Phase I: Die Dritte Macht (The Third Power, 1996)
Phase II/III: Topsider & Springer (1996)
Phase IV: Vorstoß nach Arkon (Approach to Arkon, 1997)
Phase V: Atlan & Arkon (2003)

Fanpro canceled the game in 1998. Finally Between The Stars (a company founded by fans of the game) took over and released phase V in 2003.

The player with the most victory points wins this complex game. You get victory points for completing phases and for completing side plots. Only after a phase is completed the players can draw cards from the next phase (you need separate decks for each phase you will play).

The cards show different planets, star systems, mutants with psi-talents, other persons, troops, spaceships, fleets, accessories, event cards and galactic riddles. There is also an action card deck to randomize the fights someway.

Every card can be "Pro", "Anti", or both ("Dual"). In a game you have to play two sides at the same time, the pro-side (the good guys) and the anti-side (the bad boys). After you have built up your fleets and armies (you normally hide them below other cards) you fight space fights and invasions on enemy planets: With your anti-side you attack the pro-sides of your opponents, and with your pro-side you damage their anti-sides.
18703.name: Perry Rhodan Sammelkartenspiel

18704.name: Piquet
18704.description:
From the publisher:

"PIQUET (Fr. pee-kay, anglicized pick-et) is a paper time machine that lets you ride with El Cid, command an army under Napoleon, or try to outwit the Desert Fox prior to El Alamein. Would you like to hear the whistle of arrow shafts at Agincourt? Or smell the sharp acrid haze of burnt black powder? Can your mind's eye see that ridge across the way lined with Union Troops? Let PIQUET provide the catalyst for your imagination!

PIQUET is a unique miniature wargame system that provides a master set of rules for a wide range of periods. This core set, once learned, allows the wargamer to easily game in any time period without relearning volumes of rules, or the need to constantly remount figures."

Note that the core rules do not suffice to play the game - one of the historical modules is also required.

Expanded by:

Piquet: Anchor of Faith
Piquet: Archon II
Piquet: Band of Brothers
Piquet: Cartouche
Piquet: Din of Battle
Piquet: Forgotten Heroes
Piquet: Les Grognards
Piquet: PKowboys
Piquet: Point of Attack – Barrage
Piquet: Point of Attack II – The Blitzkrieg
Piquet: Theater of War

18705.name: Piquet: Archon II
18705.description:
Refight 3000 years of history covered by Archon 2nd Edition. Can you decisively change history by defeating Alexander the Great, Caesar, or Hannibal? Will the Greeks throw back the Persians or will Xerxes reign supreme? Fight through the centuries of East Asian warfare, or try your hand at the mysterious armies of Central America. Archon 2nd edition has been re-worked and re-tooled including extensive Campaign Musters. Be a leader, not a follower, and take charge of history!

Expands:

Piquet

18706.name: Piquet: Cartouche
18706.description:
Cartouche is an eighteenth century supplement for the Piquet miniatures rules. It covers such conflicts as the Wars of Marlborough, Seven Years War, and the American Revolutionary War.

Expands:

Piquet

18707.name: Piquet: Les Grognards
18707.description:
Les Grognards 2nd Edition includes rules for 3 different game scales: Company scale (basic infantry unit is a company), Battalion scale (basic infantry unit is a battalion), and Grand Tactical scale (basic infantry unit is a brigade or regiment). Using the game scales in Les Grognards 2nd Edition, small actions from a few companies up to multiple Corps are possible. The three game scales allow experimentation with games of different scopes and scales with existing troops and mounting systems. All three scales use the same basing system; there is no need for rebasing.

Les Grognards 2nd Edition also includes Horizon Movement rules for the Battalion and Grand Tactical scale games. Horizon Movement eliminates virtually all measuring for movement. Horizon movement allows units to move based on the tabletop terrain and enemy unit's positions. Rather than measuring moves in small increments, moves are made based on limiting terrain or tactical situations. The result is a game that features dynamic, flowing movement rather than the same moves broken down into small increments as in standard measured movement games.

Les Grognards 2nd edition features completely new material, incorporating 5 sets of rules (Company scale, Battalion scale, Grand Tactical scale, Horizon Movement Battalion scale, Horizon Movement Grand Tactical scale) and 37 different army lists. The new lists allow the unique characteristics of a wide variety of armies to be represented on the tabletop. The armies covered in Les Grognards 2nd Edition include:

Expands:

Piquet

18708.description:
The 2nd Edition of Hallowed Ground has been greatly expanded to cover additional periods, as well as providing rules for new game scales. Hallowed Ground, 2nd Edition, provides three complete rule sets that cover the 19th century period from the Texas Revolution through the Russo-Turkish War. Periods covered in Hallowed Ground 2nd Edition include:

The Mexican Wars (Texas War of Independence, Mexican-American War)

The Wars in India (Sikh Wars, Indian Mutiny)

The Russian Wars (Crimean War, Russo-Turkish War)

The Taiping Rebellion

The Risorgimento (1848-49, 1859)

The Great Paraguayan War

The Wars of German Unification (1866 Austro-Prussian War, 1870 Franco-Prussian War)

The American Civil War

Three scales of game are introduced in Hallowed Ground 2nd Edition - the Company Scale game, the Battalion Scale game, and the Grand Tactical Scale game. The Company game which uses the company as the standard infantry game unit gives you the chance to be a battalion or a brigade commander in the thick of battle; the Battalion game uses battalions as the standard infantry game unit - players can easily command a division on the tabletop. The Grand Tactical game uses the infantry regiment as the standard infantry game unit - allowing players to command Corps on the tabletop. The variety of wars, battles, and skirmishes throughout the period covered by Hallowed Ground, 2nd Edition requires rules that can cover engagements of all sizes. You can use Hallowed Ground to play a skirmish between Texans and Mexicans in 1836 up to the large battles of the American Civil War and Franco-Prussian War.

Specific sequence deck compositions and army ratings for each period and army, combined with three unique sets of rules that cover different scale games, gives Hallowed Ground 2nd Edition unparalleled flexibility in gaming the vast array of conflicts of the 19th century.
18708.name: Piquet: Hallowed Ground

18709.name: Piquet: Din of Battle
18709.description:
Din of Battle covers the conflicts between the colonial powers of the 19th century and the native peoples of their intended colonies.

These rules plead no cause - most of the causes for which these past warriors fought are long ago gone. In many cases the "winners" would be surprised if they returned today to view modern South Africa, Egypt, China, or Morocco. So what these rules celebrate is the honor and bravery of men who fought for lost reasons in remote and alien lands and the courage of men who attempted to save a doomed and, in some cases, brutish way of life.

It also commemorates some of the kindest, meanest, most charitable, most selfish, bravest, most craven, brightest and most incorrigibly ignorant people that have ever walked the earth: the Victorian on a mission, the Calif with murder in his heart, the merciless Zulu, the totally mad Gordon confronting the equally mad Mahdi. What color! What excitement! This is the era of the mysteries of the Nile's source, or the hidden interior of Peking's Imperial City!

Expands:

Piquet

18710.name: Piquet: Point of Attack II – The Blitzkrieg
18710.description:
The Blitzkrieg is unique in the Piquet system in that it has three different game scales included. The different game scales allow for a wide variety of scenarios, game sizes, and game types.

The Game Scale Rules section includes unique rules for each of the three scale games included in the The Blitzkrieg game supplement (Squad, Platoon, and Battalion). Each game scale has its own Weapon Adjustment Table, game play reference sheet, quick rating BDV Tables, and organizational information.

This allows a gamers to play everything from a vicious, house-to-house skirmish combat to a multi-division, multi-day battle on the plains of Russia. The movement, combat, and morale sections of the rules were deliberately developed to fit the "zoom" concept mentioned in the original Piquet rules. By using a few unique rules, and different troop ratings, a gamer can easily move between the three scales. The basic rule mechanics are the same, only the details change. The Squad scale game is new with this version of the rules. It allows for large skirmish actions, instead of the small, highly individually personalized game typical of skirmish rules. The Squad game allows skirmish detail in games with a platoon or more of infantry on a side. The detail players enjoy in skirmish games is still there, but it is imbedded in the game system. As an example, it would be very easy to just add rules to the basic rule skeleton to handle unique cases. Consider armor in a skirmish game. Obviously, there is a difference in the combat readiness of a tank that is buttoned up compared to one which is just moving down a road. The Squad game easily handles this difference by requiring that vehicles be in a declared status - either march or deployed. March status indicates a tank or vehicle that is not combat ready, but is primarily intent on moving rapidly. Deployed status indicates a tank or vehicles that is tactically aware prepared for the uncertainties of the battlefield.

Expands:

Piquet

18711.name: Piquet: Anchor of Faith
18711.description:
Anchor of Faith warfare in the seventeenth century. At the beginning of the seventeenth century armies deployed in large units comprising many thousands of men. Firepower, while important, was still subordinate to shock of contact and the use of pole arm weapons. The period can be characterized: - The introduction of smaller formations, reduction in the use of pike and increased reliance on firepower and the development of linear tactics. Anchor of Faith allows the gamer to recreate the battles and tactics of this colorful period.

Anchor of Faith covers warfare in Europe and the fringe nations in the Middle East and Asia. The supplement introduces new rule mechanisms, formation types and army generation tables particular to the period 1600 to 1690. It combines the main rules that allow battles to be played at a regimental scale, and a sub set of rules, the Twelve Apostles, for fighting smaller actions with units typically representing a few companies of infantry or troops of cavalry. The latter being particularly useful for fighting large English Civil War skirmishes.

Anchor of Faith includes a range of new formations definitions including tercios, Swedish brigade, deep line, caracole cavalry, commanded shot, galloper cavalry and war wagons. New period rule mechanisms are introduced to mirror both the abilities and shortcomings of the troops of this era. New rules include revised pursuit rules, morale points by command and new fire rules to reflect the low effect of musketry and the importance of ‘push of pike’ in deciding the outcome of engagements. Many of the new ideas and mechanisms can be used in other Piquet periods.

Expands:

Piquet

18712.name: Piquet: Band of Brothers
18712.description:
From the designer:

Band of Brothers was a pleasant surprise for me as I found my interest in the period became greater the longer I worked on this supplement. If one is looking for a variety of unit types, tactical doctrine, or weaponry, medieval/renaissance warfare has much to offer. If one wants colorful dress and dramatic costumes, then the Landtsknecht and the Ottoman Janissaries are but a few of the many available troops. Even more appealing is that this is a period of fascinating transitions in the practice of warfare.

Two of the greatest transitional effects are the introduction and growing effectiveness of gunpowder weapons, both in the form of artillery, as well as personal weapons, and the ability for nations to field semi-national armies. The creation of these larger forces and their supply was a necessary social foundation for the Military Revolution that allowed the great armies of the 17th century and later.

Expands:

Piquet

18713.name: Grand Piquet
18713.description:
Grand Piquet 2nd Edition - Many changes were made for this new edition of Grand Piquet. The Army commander now plays a more pivotal role in the command and control of a Corps. These formations no longer move whenever or wherever they wish. A D12 is now the basis for all initiative rolls, which effectively eliminates the need for phases, as well as mitigates the wild swings in initiative. The Sequence decks have been radically altered. Now there are Action cards, by type of unit [e.g. Infantry Action card], whereby there is much greater flexibility in actions taken by units. Also, the basic Sequence deck is now made up of 20 cards, instead of 28. The combat system is based primarily on Target type, so there are fewer modifiers to calculate. The basic concept of “chipping” within the morale system is intact, yet there is no need to keep track of morale chips. Unit / sub unit designations are determined by numbers of men and not by regiment. Players determine the size and make up of a unit, thereby effectively tailoring each Command Group to a particular situation or task. These are but a few of the changes that have been made.
It is hoped that this new edition will keep the flavor and excitement of the original, while improving the mechanics, which will give a more fluid, less static feel to the game. One final comment that deserves remembering: Piquet is an innovative system designed to give players the opportunity to make command decisions based upon finite resources.

18714.name: Piquet: Point of Attack – Barrage
18714.description:
BARRAGE is a rules set designed to re-fight battles during the period of 1904 - 1935. Not only is the Great War (1914 - 1918) covered in detail, so is the Russo-Japanese War (1904 - 1905), Russian Civil War (1917 - 1921), and the Russo-Polish War (1919 - 1920). Typical unit sizes are infantry companies, cavalry squadrons, machine gun platoons, and artillery batteries. A player would generally command either a regiment or a brigade of soldiers.

The World War One portion of the rules covers the following: African, Balkan, Egypt & Palestine, Eastern, Italian, Mesopotamian, and Western fronts. The Tables of Organization & Equipment have detailed information for 16 different nations. The rules are designed to re-fight the open warfare of the early part of the WWI along with the more static trench battles later in the war. Can you lead your troops in a successful offensive?

Expands:

Piquet

18715.description:
Forgotten Heroes provides a complete package to allow you to recreate the Vietnam War. The rules will work equally well for those who want to depict the early Search and Destroy days of the war against the VC and for those who want to recreate the desperate days of the 1975 collapse. In general, the Vietnam War was fought at the company level, with the platoon of 2 - 4 squads (representing anywhere from 20 to over 40 men) being the basic maneuver element. Previously, this scale has been neglect by most miniatures rules dealing with the Vietnam War, which have focused on the individual's perspective. Forgotten Heroes enables the you to command a full infantry company (of 3 - 4 platoons) or more, and the accompanying assets, in a way no other Vietnam War era rules set has done before. It is only in this Scale that the gamer can really recreate the village sweeps, helicopter insertions into hot LZs, assaults on bunker complexes, VC convoy ambushes, riverine actions, and fire base assaults, that typified the major actions of this conflict.

Forgotten Heroes includes rules for the unique aspects of the Vietnam War. These rules include the following: VC/NVA tunnel systems, riverine craft, civilians, caches and stores, rules of engagement, booby traps, ground surveillance radar, command detonated mines, night combat effects, and many more. Forgotten Heroes also includes special event cards that can be added to the normal sequence decks, such as Chieu Hoi, DiDi Mau, General Visits Front, Hearts and Minds, Media Circus, the dreaded FUBAR, and more.

Forgotten Heroes bas been designed to be as accessible as possible to both a newcomer to the Vietnam War and he gaming veteran. The rules include information on the varied equipment used in the war and full TO&Es for the US Army, US Marine Crops, ARVN, Australians, Viet Cong, and NVA. Two introductory scenarios are included, as a bonus supplement, rules are provided for the First Indochina War including sequence decks, equipment and weapon lists, and TO& Es for the French and Viet Minh.

Expands:

Piquet
18715.name: Piquet: Forgotten Heroes

18717.name: Piquet:  Theater of War
18717.description:
Theater of War generates linked, tactical tabletop games in a larger strategic setting. Theater of War is designed to be used with miniature collections of existing, fixed sizes (no more collecting and painting forces for the next game just in order to meet the order of battle requirements!) while providing an entertaining background for a campaign with a definitive conclusion. Theater of War provides a system for determining tactical scenarios, based on decisions made by the campaign players. Theater of War includes rules for organizing campaigns in all of the periods covered by the Piquet rule system.

Theater of War vividly represents the fog and friction of war, modeled by sequence decks and initiative rolls. Battle Hands made up of Sequence cards are used to move from the campaign map to the tabletop. Battle hands determine what type of tabletop battle will be fought, as well as any particular advantages (relative army sizes, terrain, set-up) that will exist. This combination and interplay of Battle Hands is the heart and soul of Theatre of War. It allows a campaign to be fought without an umpire making rulings about force strengths and scenario definition, as well as providing for pre-battle maneuvering as both sides attempt to gain an advantage. Theatre of War places the gamer in the predicament of not knowing for sure what the tabletop game will hold - that is, not knowing until they've committed and played their cards!

Theatre of War is designed to provide a campaign framework for Piquet tabletop miniature games. In order to play Theatre of War, both the Piquet master rules and the period supplement in which the campaign is set are required.

Expands:

Piquet

18719.description:
Jump or Burn is an exciting new rule system for fighting World War One aerial dogfights using miniature aircraft. Games are ideally suited for two or more players each controlling a single aircraft. These rules have a unique unpredictable turn sequence that does away with move by move order writing and makes dogfights fast and furious. Jump or Burn is easy to learn, fast to play, but hard to master.

Jump or Burn is a stand-alone product published under the Piquet banner. Although it shares the concepts of cards and dice adjustment mechanisms it does not require Piquet Master Rules to play.

Goggles on, chocks away, and try to get back in time for tea and medals.
18719.name: Piquet: Jump or Burn

18720.name: Piquet: PKowboys
18720.description:
Pkowboys is intended to represent skirmish combat between rival gangs (outlaws, lawmen, gunslingers, and townsfolk) in the American West between 1860 and 1900. Players represent the leaders of different gangs, or in large battles a player may act as the leader of multiple gangs.

Pkowboys does not use the standard Piquet initiative system. Instead, We have developed a fast an furious method to handle individual figure movement and action on the tabletop.

Here are the principles behind the design of Pkowboys.

Western combat was quick and decisive. Gun battles lasted minutes or seconds. Any shot has the chance of being lethal. Many gunfighters lost their nerve and fled when under fire. Leadership was as important with gangs of outlaws or lawmen as it was in large battles. The Jesse James/Wild Bill Hickock Theory: being unlucky is a bad thing no matter how good you are. Gunfight tactics in a nutshell: move into a good position and shoot like mad.

Saddle up pardner and fire away!!!!!

Expands:

Piquet

18721.name: Skeletons in the Closet
18721.description: Rather than using rote memorization, put an exciting new spin on learning the names, location, and relationships of the major bones in the human body (skull, pelvis, tibia, rib cage and more). First player to assemble their skeleton in the closet wins. Bones are labeled with letters to help identify each bone and assemble the skeleton faster. Six challenging games with varying levels of difficulty. Includes 50 True/False Fun Bone Facts, 10 milk cartons, 30 closet cards, closet box, four plastic skeleton models, four skeleton boards, game guide, and spinner.

18722.name: Ambition 5000
18722.description: Ambition 5000 is a dice game where you try to get to 5000 points. It uses 3 special dice marked "A", "P", "D", "50" or "100". Special rules allow for surprising turns of events.

boardgameintegration: Aye, Dark Overlord! The Green Box
Aye, Dark Overlord! The Green Box
boardgamehonor: 2005 Lucca Games Best Original Game
18723.description:
Aye, Dark Overlord! is a fantasy party game filled with humor that's fast to play and easy to learn.

Each player is an evil goblin servant of the evil Dark Overlord — Rigor Mortis, the Master of all Evils — and all of them are gathered at the Dark Overlord's knees to explain why they brought that last important mission, ordered by "His Evil Excellence" himself, to failure again. Panic wraps you in its freezing grip; what can you do to save your poor skin? Could you say you are not the one to blame, but your inept companions? Yes, of course, that's the solution! There is only one little problem: They've probably got exactly the same idea...and the Dark Overlord is not known for his mercy...

This roleplaying game is all about telling lies and shifting the blame on your poor fellow ones, so the righteous wrath of your Master can give them what they deserve!

Aye, Dark Overlord! The Red Box is the most recent name of this game, to distinguish it from The Green Box, which is both a standalone game and an expansion for this one.
18723.name: Aye, Dark Overlord! The Red Box
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 83-- Live from GEN CON Part 2-- from the show floor
The Messy Game Room Episode 5

18724.description:
from the publisher's website :

It is the spring of 1862 and the Civil War is at a stalemate in the east. The Confederate Army, victorious at Bull Run, sits watching warily across the Potomac at McClellans 100,000 plus troops train and prepare for the coming campaign season. McClellan is being spurred by politicians and press to use the army he has molded for operations besides drill.

McClellan launches a bold flanking maneuver, taking his juggernaut by boat to the tip of the Virginia Peninsula at Fort Monroe. He slowly moves westward towards Richmond. This forces Johnston to react and fight or lose Richmond. The battles at Williamsburg, Fair Oaks, Savage Station, Mechanicsville, Gaines Mill, White Oak Swamp, and Malvern Hill will forever be seared into the memories of the participants. It is here that the Army of Northern Virginia and the Army of the Potomac will be forged in the fire of battle.

Forged In Fire is Worthington Games strategic level block game covering this campaign which should have and could have ended the Civil War three years earlier. The game features a mapboard displaying from the Virginia Peninsula to Richmond. It gives players the opportunity to fight the full campaign from McClellans advance to the emergence of Lee. The game includes the complete Peninsula Campaign as well as three scenarios: the Union advance from Fort Monroe to the Chickahominy River, Johnston's attack at Fair Oaks, and the emergence of Lee during the Seven Day's Battles.

This game includes map, hardwood counters, labels, rules, dice, and necessary player aids.
18724.name: Forged in Fire: The 1862 Peninsula Campaign

18725.description:
This German trading card game is based on the weekly science fiction series Perry Rhodan. It continues the story from the Tolkander cylce (novellas 1800-1875) after the Tolkanders are destroyed.

In the game you explore the devastated globular cluster "47 Tucani" (47 Tucanae) with one of the 4 involved powers: Liga Freier Terraner (league of free terrans), Kristallimperium (crystal empire), Forum Raglund and Galactic Guardians. The player with 6 victory points wins the game. You get them for sacrificing your own planets or for destroying opponent planets with your cards which exist of ships, accessories, effects, phenomenons and alien technology.
18725.name: Perry Rhodan Firestorm

18726.name: Rodeo, The Wild West Game
18726.description: Rodeo is a family game where players participate in up to five different rodeo events (bulldogging, calf roping, bull riding, etc.). Action is controlled with a spinner, so luck is usually the governor of outcome. But so is the selection of a bull when you're riding. A fun game for the family.

18727.name: Coupez !
18727.description:
The gameboard represents a movie theater. You advance from seat to seat by answering questions and solving riddles correctly. The first player to reach the screen wins the game.

The game comes with 500 questions and is packaged in a wooden box.

18728.name: Generatorb
18728.description:
Generatorb is a game of jumping and capturing where you attempt to get one of your own pieces in your opponent's generator square.

Generatorb is played on a basic 8×8 square board (a checkers or chess board works great) that is turned sideways so the squares become diamonds. The playing pieces, called Orbs, should be flat disks that can be stacked (red and black checkers are great). You'll need 24 Orbs for each player.

Rules: http://www.tjgames.com/genrule.html

Online Play


Super Duper Games

18729.name: Peon
18729.description: Try to move up the ladder in medieval society, from the lowliest peon to the loftiest king... but beware: this ladder goes both ways.

18730.name: Looney Bin
18730.description: Compete to identify the zany mental ailments of your teammates -- without letting the other side "in" on your diagnosis. Fantastic game for parties, mixers, and long road trips.

18731.name: c-jump Computer Programming Board Game
18731.description:
Discover the fundamentals of computer programming by playing a board game! c-jump helps children to learn basics of programming languages, such as C, C++ and Java.

The game teaches basic commands of a programming language, such as "if", "else", "switch", and introduces variable "x" concept.

Skiers and snowboarders line up at the start location and race along the ski trails. Spaces on the board show statements of programming language. First player to move all skiers past the finish line is the winner.

Players calculate number of steps in the move, including addition, subtraction, division, and multiplication of small numbers. The game helps to develop understanding of a complete computer program, formed by logical sequences of commands.

18732.name: Marvel Super Heroes Game
18732.description: A roll-and-move kids' game where players try to hire super heroes onto their team and capture super villains. Features traditional Marvel super heroes like Spider-man and Hulk as well as X-Men. Ages 6 and up

18733.name: 100 Plus
18733.description: A ladder-type trick-taking game in which the object of the game is for players to first make 100 points by taking ten tricks of ten points each. Second is to make whatever number appears on the randomly-drawn "plus number" disk, thus making "100 plus". The first player to do this wins.

18734.name: Somewhere in the Rockies
18734.description: We are partners in the TK&RL Transport Business, with our own lines of trains and trucks for collecting and delivering various goods to Mr. Big's coastal warehouses. Mr. Big pays us well for everything we bring in plus bonuses for filling each warehouse. The risks are great, what with the roads and rails getting wiped out by snow storms and rock slides, not to mention government cutbacks leaving the infrastructure in dangerous shape. Only partners with nerves of steel and alert brains need apply for the job. If you have what it takes, join us in a railway and trucking adventure.

18735.name: Ogres & Elves
18735.description:
The royal elf family is coming to visit their mountain kingdom. They want us elves to fill their treasure chests with the different gems we mine. However, ogres have heard about the visit and plan to grab all the valuables for themselves. We must do our best to get royals and ogres alike to share the goodies. Easy to say. This requires lots of tricky teamwork with each game increasing in difficulty. Strap on your invisible shields, dear elves and head for the mines. The royals are coming.
Ages 5 and up.

18736.name: CSI: Miami
boardgamefamily: TV Series: CSI – Crime Scene Investigation
18736.description:
FEEL THE HEAT OF MIAMI!

Behind the sun, surf and palm trees lurks a darker world. You will quickly learn that each suspect is capable of deceit. By rolling the CSI: Miami die you will follow the evidence, identify the killer and reveal the truth.

Can you handle the heat?

Follow lead criminalist, Horatio Caine, and his team of CSIs to collect three levels of evidence in order to solve each crime. CSI: Miami The Board Game features eight crime stories written in the fascinating, compelling style of the hit series, CSI: Miami.

The object of the game is the be the first investigator to submit a correct arrest warrant, proving means, motive and opportunity for one of the three suspects.

What's in the box?
CSI: MIAMI Game Board
8 Crime Cases
40 CSI: Miami Challenge Cards
22 Suspect and Evidence Cards per Case
The CSI: Miami Handbook
Arrest Warrant Pad
6 CSI Player Pieces
12- Sided Die

Expanded by:

CSI: Miami Booster Pack

18737.name: Godzilla Game
18737.description:
Godzilla Game
"Will you survive the mighty monster's attack?"

Game Includes:
Space Spinner and moving Space Platform on a Space Base
24 Multi-colored spaceships (4 sets of 6)
Instructions

Load the spaceships on the Space Platform! Whirl the Space Spinner! Rotate the Space Platform! Watch Godzilla Spring out and grab a spaceship! No one knows when! Player with the last spaceship left wins the game!

18738.name: A History of Games Played with the Tarot Pack: The Game of Triumphs
18738.description: Two volume set covering virtually all that is now known of Tarot, Tarock, and Tarocchi games. The sole concern of these two volumes is the evolution of the Tarot card game rules with only a mention in passing of the occult uses of Tarot cards in the preface and very few illustrations of Tarot cards. Essentially, this is an update of Dummett's 1980 book "Game of Tarot."

18739.name: The White Wine Game
18739.description:
From the publisher:

The WHITE WINE GAME is an adult board game that combines wine, food and strategy to produce fun. You provide a bottle of any white table wine, your choice of four food items and 2 to 6 adults. The WHITE WINE GAME provides the strategy and the fun.


Why you will enjoy the WHITE WINE GAME Have fun and experience a stimulating strategic challenge while enjoying your favorite wine.



No prior knowledge of wine is necessary to play.



Wine enthusiasts and beginners can play the game together without either person having a major advantage.



Learn more regarding wine and great food and wine pairings.



Make the game a unique experience each time you play by varying the wines and food items.



A great way for wine enthusiasts to share their passion in a way that is fun and educational for everyone.


Game includes 40-page booklet, Tips For Enjoying Wine And This Game...Recipes For Complementing Wine And This Game with suggestions for selecting and serving wine, descriptions of 30 types of white wine and recipes for 45 food items.

From the publisher's website:
"Players begin by viewing, smelling and tasting the wine to record the colors, aromas and flavors they observe. Points are earned as players move around the game board and land on spaces corresponding to the wine characteristics identified by the most players. Most enjoyable, players visit Food Match spaces where they sample the wine in combination with a food item. In the Complete Version of the game, players gain and lose sets of Recipe cards that add to their point totals. At the end of the game, players total their points to determine a winner and discuss their observations regarding the wine and food."

18740.description:
The audience is cheering and applauding when Beppo (the clown) enters the arena. On top of the wobbly tower the clown prepares his most difficult performance. But he needs your help: Try to pull a pedestal out of the tower without Beppo or the tower falling down.

Ages 5 and up
18740.name: Knall & Fall

18741.description:
Essentially Trivial Pursuit for children. Question sets are made for different classes. The board has two sides: one for groups 3-4 and one for groups 5-8 of the Dutch 'Basisschool'.

It's very much like Trivial Pursuit, with a few added options.
18741.name: Het Grote Basisschoolspel

18742.name: Twin Scribbage
18742.description:
Essentially 2 sets of Scribbage aka Ad-lib Crossword Cubes packaged together, but with new rules.

The 2 sets of cubes are colored differently.

18743.name: Guru
18743.description:
Guru is the love generation's remodeling of Go, for four swingers (players).

For two players, each player has ten pegs. Play on board to form a line of 5 to win. After 10 pegs have been played then a player moves a peg.

18744.name: Thimk
